body_html:
@Timmmm, your analysis is partially true. You need to track both changes of branches and commit changes to that branch. the gen/branch_ref tracks commits to the branch, and the gen/head tracks changes to what the current branch is. So if you get rid of gen/branch_ref, the git sha will not change when you commit a new change.

---workspace_status_command is the right way to go in any case.

But let's put this change in now to remove the annoyance.
